Aristotle Pagaltzis wrote:
> 
> 
> * Berend de Boer <berend@... <mailto:berend%40pobox.com>> 
> [2008-09-11 03:10]:
>  > I can't speak for XMPP BOSH, but for example with Apache, every
>  > open connection is 1 apache process. A server with 2GB memory
>  > with a typical PHP framework can run about 75 processes = 75
>  > users if we leave the connection open.
> 
> How is that the technique’s problem and not Apache’s?

Really? How is *not* a problem?

It's not just about flipping over to epoll. There's too much deployed 
web infrastructure that scales on the basis of connections being 
released and requests being short lived things. Like load balancers.  It 
doesn't abstract away easily.

Bill
